body.name: The Duke's Heartfelt Dilemma: A Historical Regency Romance Novel

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Trying to find a way to be together
reviews.reviewText: Gillian and the Duke have had a past but when they meet again they start to heal. But their family feud and the society’s reaction to things that are happening make for a difficult situation to overcome. But with her family and his starting to have expectations will they find a different outcome? I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy of this story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Gillian and George
reviews.reviewText: This story focuses on childhood friends reuniting as adults, and finding they both still have feelings for the other. Unfortunately, due to their mothers disliking each other, they plot and manipulate the path of their children. I thought their husbands were both very weak and lacked spines. The drama generated by this author was the hero and heroine trying to work around their mothers, and attempting to determine what was the history behind their mothers’ feud. Her creative plot building focused on unshakable judgmental beliefs, and uncompromising assumptions. The self-serving needs of the mothers seemed to be the primary focus of the story, never considering their child’ happiness, as they were forcing them to each marry another. I received a complimentary ARC, but I am voluntarily offering my personal opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Christian Standalone Romance HEA
reviews.reviewText: Gillian is shunned when lies are spread throughout the ton. Thankfully, she finds peace at the home of her aunt and uncle's home. Gregory is shocked to return home to hear the scandal about Gillian. He doesn't believe a word of it but no one will tell him where she went. Years later will a broken wheel be the opening they need to reunite or will their mothers continue to keep them apart. Scandals pile up, multiple couples are affected, societal pressures weigh against them all. Will any of them get to marry for love?I received a copy from the author. Review voluntarily given.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Gillian and Gregory, although childhood friends, were denied any chance for a courtship due to both a lying scandal and their two mothers having developed a feud over the years. Just when they finally reconnect again they are faced with the two mother’s schemes to keep them separated. Eventually in the end they find their hea. It was a sweet and clean story I personally feel both Gregory and Gillian’s fathers were two very cowardly men who both could have verbally and literally put a stop the spiteful domineering women’s plans long before things spiraled out of control and to the point that both Gillian and Gregory were forced into a betrothal to the wrong people. Not a very brave hero at all

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great read.
reviews.reviewText: No fault of her own Gillian was involved in a scandal and her parents sent her to live with her aunt. Now three years later Gillians old childhood friend accidentally meets her at her aunts. The love they shared when younger is as great as it had been. Before they can talk about it her mother shows up and takes her to London where she had a man set to court her. Both of their mothers have them set to marry another, but fate has other plans and before they know it everyone is marrying the one they love.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A sweet story of love shared between two childhood friends. Parents choose people for them to marry and this starts a whole new of twists and turns.The characters were chosen wisely and the story line was very interesting and well thought out.Way too many errors to get a five star rating, but a good read, Bridget. I like the stories you weave, but I want you to do a better job of proofreading.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Childhood affection grows to love along with challenges
reviews.reviewText: Bridget Barton is my favorite regency romance author and she does not disappoint with this book. Gillian and Gregory were very close as children. They are both intelligent and caring, and have many similar interests. The characters keep your attention and I loved the twists and turns that kept them apart. Great dialogue and the pace of the story makes it hard to put down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The Duke's Heartfelt Dilemma is a new Regency novel by Bridget Barton. I enjoyed reading about Gillian and Gregory. Regency rules and the Ton's expectations are keeping them apart. I believe that this author knows how to write wonderful romance books. Escape in the 1800s where the Lords and Ladies find love.

Charmingly likeable story of the eternally beautiful love between two childhood friends who have endured enough suffering due to events caused by people who are self-centred, insensitive, and unable to forgive!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: When Mothers Do Not Know Best
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this book. It is well-written. Duke Gregory and Gillian had been childhood friends. Gregory had gone away for a while and during that time Gillian had been accused of misbehaving. She was innocent but her name was published and she was ruined. She went to live with the uncle's family in the country. When Gregory returned he had hoped to meet Gillian again but was disappointed to find she had left London. He decided to travel to his estate but his carriage broke down near an orphanage and he was amazed to see Gillian with the children. Gregory and Gillian were delighted to meet up again and rekindled their relationship but their mothers were set against them. I felt really sorry for Gregory and Gillian. Why should an old argument prevent Gregory and Gillian finding happiness and force them into marriages with someone they do not love? Their mothers were determined to force them apart. Would Gregory be able to fight against Gillian's motherand his own? Would Gillian's father be able to stand up for Gillian? Read on and enjoy.
